result.execSummary:
The defendant John Keith Ellis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-THC (>10,000 g), a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)5.
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: CONCURRENT to Count 3 and any other case; with credit for 312 days time served

superMiscConds.notes: Pay all court costs, fees, assessment and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge to be paid through collection by the DOC's from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance due 3-01-2019; failure to pay will result in an entry of a civil judgment.

No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm holster, firearm magazine, or any body armor. Defendant may not possess identification documents other than his own for John Keith Ellis. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: Firearm possess and Voting.

Court advises the defendant that under Wisconsin Statue 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the defendant being returned to prison.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no alcohol.
- No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including drug and alcohol testing.
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for person use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- No contact with any Laquinta Inn throughout the County.
- Defendant is not to possess cash currency in an amount greater than $150.00 at any one time.
- No possession of more than 1 cell phone or more than 1 phone number listed under the defendants name at one time.
-No contact with Jordan A. Under section 973.049 Court finds and prohibits contact with Jordan A. as she was a co-actor and it is in the interest of the public to prohibit contact.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done.
- Court ordered defendant to comply with all Child Support Court Orders.

supervisions.notes: Pay all court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge to be paid through collection by the DOC's from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any reamining balance due 03-01-16; failure to pay will result in an entry of a civil judgment

Concurrent with: Count 1 and consecutive to any other case
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done.

records.addlTxt: Count three
Count one.

Defendant John Keith Ellis in court with attorney Peter J. Kovac.  Defendant John Keith Ellis in custody.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
AS TO COUNT 3:
Court ordered defendant to serve 8 MONTHS incarceration concurrent to COUNT 1 and consecutive to any other case; credit for 312 days time served.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 

Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge to paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance due 3-1-2016; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment. 
AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 9 YEARS, concurrent to Count 3 and consecutive to any other case, with credit for 312 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 4 YEARS.  
Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program. 
Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge to paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance due 3-1-2019; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment. 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:

- Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no alcohol.
- No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid 
  prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
  and successfully complete recommended treatment
  including drug and alcohol testing. 
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm holster, firearm magazine, or any body armor.
- Defendant may not possess identification documents other than his own for John Keith Ellis. 
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- No contact with any Laquinta Inn throughout the Country. 
- Defendant is not to possess cash currency in an amount greater than $150.00 at any one time.
- No possession of more than 1 cell phone or more than 1 phone number listed under the Defendants name at one time. 
- No contact with Jordan A. 
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
- Court ordered Defendant to comply with all child support court orders. 

- Under section 973.049 Court finds and prohibits contact with Jordan A. as she was a coactor and it is in the interest of the public to prohibit contact.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Court advises the Defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the Defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The Defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the Defendant being returned to prison.

signed Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;

Defendant John Keith Ellis in court with attorney Peter J. Kovac.  Defendant John Keith Ellis in custody.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case proceeds to Plea Hearing.
AS TO COUNT 1 and 3 - 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
AS TO COUNT 2 -
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 2 dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Court orders case adjourned for Sentencing on 3-2-2015 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Hauer for the State and Attorney Kovac from the Defense are present in Court. Defense counsel is in a Jury Trial in a another courtroom and requests an adjournment. Case rescheduled for Plea Hearing from 2-2-2015 at 1:30 p.m. to 2-5-2015 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.

Sworn and examined for the Defense: John Ellis. Parties stipulate to the number of prior convictions: more than one.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.

No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription and no drug paraphernalia.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
